channel.title: Mystery Box Error
channel.description:
Ok so I tried adding a working mystery box to my Allstar source (317) When I compile it I get this error
[URL=http://imgur.com/eEvglxk][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/eEvglxk.png[/img][/URL]
Can someone please explain how to fix this? I can't seem to get it working.

item.title: Mystery Box Error
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:10, topic:519848”][quote author=ReaperXScape link=topic=638341.msg4302882#msg4302882 date=1369270636]
lol why didnt u just ak me? replace randommystery with randommystery()
please ask me first, even if im not online
[/quote]
People have the right to ask whoever they would like to.[/quote]

ReaperXScape and I are like partners. We are helping each other.

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box Error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

sendMessage(playerName + “received " + randomMystery().itemToName() + " from the mystery box!”);

Now, that isn’t right at ll, but that is the general idea.
You need to find the method that converts item ID’s to their names in your server (Most have them) and replace itemToName with that, and fix the sendMessage, and playerName.

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box Error
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:5, topic:519848”]very simple your code has to be like this:

addItem(randomMystery(), 1);[/quote]

Thank you very much that worked.
And can someone teach me how I can make it like
Username has just received item name from the mystery box. in the chatbox

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box Error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“zeropointx, post:4, topic:519848”]Instead of

public static int randomMystery() { return Mystery[(int) (Math.random() * Mystery.length)]; }
Generate proper random number if your source has something like Utils.random(number)[/quote]
I’m sorry but what?
Math.random() is the java method to make a random number.
Untils.random() (like you said) is actually just Math.random()…

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box Error
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

very simple your code has to be like this:

addItem(randomMystery(), 1);

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box Error
item.dc:creator: @zeropointx zeropointx
item.description:
@zeropointx wrote:

[quote=“GodexCAB, post:3, topic:519848”][code]add this to top of client.java under void badnames()

public static int Mystery[] = {15000, 7954, 7388, 7161, 6962, 6585, 6737, 6731, 6735, 6382, 6199, 6188, 5945, 5698, 4827, 4447, 4202, 995, 2528};
public static int randomMystery() {
    return Mystery[(int) (Math.random() * Mystery.length)];
}

next search - case 391:
you will see

case 391:
        healing[1] = 40;
        healing[2] = 40;
        healing[3] = -1;
break;

under the break; add this :

case 6199:
addItem(randomMystery, 1);
deleteItem(6199, getItemSlot(6199), 1);
break;[/code]

I got that quick tut from a friend[/quote]
Instead of

public static int randomMystery() { return Mystery[(int) (Math.random() * Mystery.length)]; }
Generate proper random number if your source has something like Utils.random(number)

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box Error
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[code]add this to top of client.java under void badnames()

public static int Mystery[] = {15000, 7954, 7388, 7161, 6962, 6585, 6737, 6731, 6735, 6382, 6199, 6188, 5945, 5698, 4827, 4447, 4202, 995, 2528};
public static int randomMystery() {
    return Mystery[(int) (Math.random() * Mystery.length)];
}

next search - case 391:
you will see

case 391:
        healing[1] = 40;
        healing[2] = 40;
        healing[3] = -1;
break;

under the break; add this :

case 6199:
addItem(randomMystery, 1);
deleteItem(6199, getItemSlot(6199), 1);
break;[/code]

I got that quick tut from a friend

Read full topic
